mn10:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati?
mn10:4.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of the body?

mn10:32.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati?
mn10:32.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of feelings?

mn10:34.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu citte cittānupassī viharati?
mn10:34.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of the mind?

mn10:36.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati?
mn10:36.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles?

mn10:36.3.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati pañcasu nīvaraṇesu?
mn10:36.3.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the five hindrances?

mn10:38.2.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu?
mn10:38.2.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the five grasping aggregates?

mn10:40.2.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati chasu ajjhattikabāhiresu āyatanesu?
mn10:40.2.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the six interior and exterior sense fields?

mn10:42.2.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati sattasu bojjhaṅgesu?
mn10:42.2.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the seven awakening factors?

mn10:44.2.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati catūsu ariyasaccesu?
mn10:44.2.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the four noble truths?

dn22:2.1.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati?
dn22:2.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of the body?

dn22:11.1.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati?
dn22:11.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of feelings?

dn22:12.1.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu citte cittānupassī viharati?
dn22:12.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of the mind?

dn22:13.1.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati?
dn22:13.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles?

dn22:13.3.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati pañcasu nīvaraṇesu?
dn22:13.3.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the five hindrances?

dn22:14.2.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu?
dn22:14.2.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the five grasping aggregates?

dn22:15.2.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati chasu ajjhattikabāhiresu āyatanesu?
dn22:15.2.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the six interior and exterior sense fields?

dn22:16.2.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati sattasu bojjhaṅgesu?
dn22:16.2.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the seven awakening factors?

dn22:17.2.pli: Kathañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati catūsu ariyasaccesu?
dn22:17.2.en: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles with respect to the four noble truths?

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 22
The Longer Discourse on Mindfulness Meditation

sn51.20:7.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pacchāpuresaññī ca viharati—
sn51.20:7.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate perceiving before and behind:

sn51.20:8.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathā adho tathā uddhaṁ, yathā uddhaṁ tathā adho viharati?
sn51.20:8.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate as below, so above; as above, so below?

sn51.20:9.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathā divā tathā rattiṁ, yathā rattiṁ tathā divā viharati?
sn51.20:9.1.en: And how does a mendicant meditate as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day?
